H0.text: Flying and breathing are two processes common to all living things.

H1.text: Migrating and reproducing are two processes common to all living things.

H2.text: Using nutrients and growing are two processes common to all living things.

H3.text: Eliminating waste and hibernating are the two processes common to all living things.

A4.text: The three main functions of metabolism are the conversion of energy in food into a usable form for cellular processes; the conversion of food to building blocks of macromolecules; and the excretion of metabolic wastes.

A5.text: These enzyme-catalyzed reactions allow organisms to grow, reproduce, maintain their structures, and respond to their environments.
